code: import React from'react';import person1 from"../../assets/dharma.png";import{jsx as _jsx}from"react/jsx-runtime";import{jsxs as _jsxs}from"react/jsx-runtime";import{Fragment as _Fragment}from"react/jsx-runtime";export default function DharmSinghJat(){return/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs(_Fragment,{children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"container-fluid",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{class:"row align-items-center justify-content-center p-5",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"col-md-3 col-12",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("img",{src:person1,alt:"",class:"img-fluid"})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{class:"mt-3 col-md-6 col-12",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h2",{children:"Prof. Dharm Singh Jat"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("p",{style:{fontFamily:"Nunito"},children:"Professor"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("p",{style:{fontFamily:"Nunito"},children:"Namibia University of Science and Technology (NUST)"})]})]})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"container-fluid",style:{fontFamily:"Nunito"},children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"row justify-content-center text-justify",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"col-8",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("p",{children:"Dharm Singh received his degree Master of Engineering and PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from prestigious universities in India. He is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science of Namibia's University of Science and Technology. From 1990 to 2014, he was with the College of Technology and Engineering, MPUAT, Udaipur, India and has more than 26 years of academic experience. He was instrumental in the setting up of the MPUAT Intranet. He has given several Guest Lecturers/Invited talks at various prestigious conferences 45th Annual National Convention of the Computer Society of India (2010), the 26th Indian Engineering Congress at Bangalore (2011) and various ACM conferences as an ACM Speaker. More than 8 PhD and 30 Master students have guided who are occupying leading positions including professors in academia and industry. His interests span the areas of multimedia communications, wireless technologies, mobile communication systems, roof computing and video transmission over wired-wireless networks, Software Defined Networks, Network security, Internet of things and ICTs Applications. He has been the recipient of more than 16 prestigious awards, such as the Eminent Scientist Award, Distinguished Academic Achievement, Eminent Engineering Personality, Significant Contribution \u2013National level, Best Technical Staff, Outstanding Services, IEI Fellow, Senior Member IEEE and Distinguished ACM Speaker. Formed Special Interest Group on Wireless Networks of Computer Society of India and designated first Convener and Chairman, SIG-WNs by CSI. He was a Member of the review committee for accreditation and chairing of two programmes of the review committee for accreditation appointed by the Council on Higher Education, Maseru, Lesotho. Organised more than Workshops, National workshops, National Seminars and Conferences, In-country workshops and ACM and IEEE International Conferences as Chair or Secretary. Prof Sing is a working group member of IEEE P1931TMIEEE and IEEE P1932.1TM Standards. He is the sole author of 04 Books and an editor of 16 books including Springer-edited books and IEEE conference proceedings and has authored/co-authored over 135 research publications in peer-reviewed reputed journals, book chapters and conference proceedings. An upright affiliation of various engineering societies like Fellow of The Institution of Engineers (India), Life Senior Member, IACSIT, Senior Member, Computer Society of India (CSI), Senior Member Institute of IEEE and Life member, The Indian Science Congress Association (Engineering Science)."})})})})]});}

sourcesContent:
import React from 'react' import person1 from "../../assets/dharma.png"; export default function DharmSinghJat() { return ( <>

Prof. Dharm Singh Jat

Professor

Namibia University of Science and Technology (NUST)

{/* Dharm Singh received his degree Master of Engineering and PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from prestigious universities in India. He is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science of Namibia's University of Science and Technology. From 1990 to 2014, he was with College of Technology and Engineering, MPUAT, Udaipur, India and has more than 26 years' academic experience. He was instrumental in the setting up of MPUAT Intranet. He has given several Guest Lecturer/Invited talk at various prestigious conferences 45th Annual National Convention of Computer Society of India (2010), 26th Indian Engineering Congress at Bangalore (2011) and various ACM conferences as ACM Speaker. More than 8 PhD and 30 Master students have guided who are occupying leading positions including Professor in academia and industry. His interests span the areas of multimedia communications, wireless technologies, mobile communication systems, roof computing and video transmission over wired-wireless networks, Software Defined Networks, Network security, Internet of things and ICTs Applications. He has been the recipient of more than 16 prestigious awards, such as Eminent Scientist Award, Distinguished Academic Achievement, Eminent Engineering Personality, Significant Contribution –National level , Best Technical Staff, Outstanding Services, IEI Fellow, Senior Member IEEE and Distinguished ACM Speaker. Formed Special Interest Group on Wireless Networks of Computer Society of India and designated first Convener and Chairman, SIG-WNs by CSI. He was Member of review committee for accreditation and chairing of two programmes of review committee for accreditation appointed by Council on Higher Education, Maseru, Lesotho. Organised more than Workshops, National workshops, National Seminars and Conferences, In-country workshop and ACM and IEEE International Conference as Chair or Secretary. Prof Sing is working groups’ member of IEEE P1931TMIEEE and IEEE P1932.1TM Standards. He is the sole author of 04 Books and an editor of 16 books including Springer edited books and IEEE conference proceedings and has authored/co-authored over 135 research publications in peer-reviewed reputed journals, book chapters and conference proceedings. An upright affiliation of various engineering societies like: Fellow of The Institution of Engineers (India), Life Senior Member, IACSIT, Senior Member, Computer Society of India (CSI), Senior Member Institute of IEEE and Life member, The Indian Science Congress Association (Engineering Science). */} Dharm Singh received his degree Master of Engineering and PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from prestigious universities in India. He is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science of Namibia's University of Science and Technology. From 1990 to 2014, he was with the College of Technology and Engineering, MPUAT, Udaipur, India and has more than 26 years of academic experience. He was instrumental in the setting up of the MPUAT Intranet. He has given several Guest Lecturers/Invited talks at various prestigious conferences 45th Annual National Convention of the Computer Society of India (2010), the 26th Indian Engineering Congress at Bangalore (2011) and various ACM conferences as an ACM Speaker. More than 8 PhD and 30 Master students have guided who are occupying leading positions including professors in academia and industry. His interests span the areas of multimedia communications, wireless technologies, mobile communication systems, roof computing and video transmission over wired-wireless networks, Software Defined Networks, Network security, Internet of things and ICTs Applications. He has been the recipient of more than 16 prestigious awards, such as the Eminent Scientist Award, Distinguished Academic Achievement, Eminent Engineering Personality, Significant Contribution –National level, Best Technical Staff, Outstanding Services, IEI Fellow, Senior Member IEEE and Distinguished ACM Speaker. Formed Special Interest Group on Wireless Networks of Computer Society of India and designated first Convener and Chairman, SIG-WNs by CSI. He was a Member of the review committee for accreditation and chairing of two programmes of the review committee for accreditation appointed by the Council on Higher Education, Maseru, Lesotho. Organised more than Workshops, National workshops, National Seminars and Conferences, In-country workshops and ACM and IEEE International Conferences as Chair or Secretary. Prof Sing is a working group member of IEEE P1931TMIEEE and IEEE P1932.1TM Standards. He is the sole author of 04 Books and an editor of 16 books including Springer-edited books and IEEE conference proceedings and has authored/co-authored over 135 research publications in peer-reviewed reputed journals, book chapters and conference proceedings. An upright affiliation of various engineering societies like Fellow of The Institution of Engineers (India), Life Senior Member, IACSIT, Senior Member, Computer Society of India (CSI), Senior Member Institute of IEEE and Life member, The Indian Science Congress Association (Engineering Science).

) }
